lines.text: [Music]
Last time on Trebuchet Village, our heroes awoke from a night of bronzing each other's body parts
and having some good fun playing music.
Their fun that next morning was rudely interrupted by Thorax,
who just wanted them to get ready for the fight in the arena.
At this suggestion, the boy said, "Well, why don't you fight with us?"
and Thorax reluctantly agreed that maybe he should.
On their way there, they experienced Gal Gadot in more of its grandeur,
experiencing the kind of speciesism that hurts someone like Evil Stevel being a dwarf.
Which he got full on from the shaman, Giggy, who was a member of Thorax's gang.
Upon arriving at the arena, the boys fought Ola, the orc, to get her on their side so that they can get the deal.
A confusing fight where much was espoused about love, who was in love with whom,
Who is a better DM, patches or scratches, some body horror, dark sexual behavior, the things you expect from the show at this point.
Almost, I think all of it.
We're gonna have to run that back.
Can we bring Scratches back to talk about this?
However, the gang easily bested Ola and agreed to her offer over the walrus, which wasn't
so much an offer as much as a guarantee of two fish being a part of the equation at some
point.
However, once the boys left the arena, the strange, surreal, and frankly overwritten
feeling swept over them, as they realized that the nasty shaman Gigi and the prince,
whom they've neglected for some time, vanished during the fight.
